WHO Declares Coronavirus Is 10 Times More Deadly Than Swine Flu And It's Worrying

WHO Declares Coronavirus Is 10 Times More Deadly Than Swine Flu And It's Worrying

Coronavirus is 10 times more deadly than swine flu, according to WHO. Swine flu was a global pandemic back in 2009. WHO also stressed the need for a vaccine to stop complete transmission.

WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that they were learning something new at all times about the new virus which has brought the world to its knees. Nearly 115,000 people are dead and over 1.8 million infected.



"We know that COVID-19 spreads fast, and we know that it is deadly, 10 times deadlier than the 2009 flu pandemic," he said in a virtual hearing as per a report in AFP.



AFP

WHO says 18,500 people died of "swine flu", or H1N1, which was first uncovered in Mexico and the United States in March 2009, but the Lancet medical estimated the toll to be between 151,700 and 575,400.



COVID -19 627 SHARES 730 SHARES 414 SHARES 17 K SHARES 10.4 K SHARES 724 SHARES 2.1 K SHARES 104.3 K SHARES 412 SHARES 3.9 K SHARES 2.2 K SHARES 440 SHARES 2.3 K SHARES

The Lancet review included estimated deaths in Africa and Southeast Asia that were not accounted for by the WHO.



The outbreak, which was declared a pandemic in June 2009 and considered over by August 2010, turned out to be not as deadly as first feared.



AFP

Vaccines were rushed out, but in hindsight, the West, particularly Europe, and the WHO were criticised for overreacting at a time when annual influenza epidemics every year killed between 250,000 and 500,000 people, according to WHO.



Tedros lamented that some countries are seeing a doubling of cases every three to four days, but stressed that if countries were committed to "early case-finding, testing, isolating (and) caring for every case and tracing every contact" they could rein in the virus.



More than half of the planet's population is currently staying home as part of efforts to stem the spread of the virus, but Tedros warned that "our global connectedness means the risk of re-introduction and resurgence of the disease will continue".



AFP

He pointed out that while COVID-19 had accelerated quickly, "it decelerates much more slowly."



"In other words, the way down is much slower than the way up," he said, stressing that "control measures must be lifted slowly, and with control. It cannot happen all at once."



"Control measures can only be lifted if the right public health measures are in place, including significant capacity for contact tracing," he said.



Don't Miss

Regardless of the efforts put in place, the WHO acknowledged that "ultimately, the development and delivery of a safe and effective vaccine will be needed to fully interrupt transmission".



A vaccine is thought to be at least 12 to 18 months away.



With Inputs From AFP

1 /6 मंदिर की धर्मशाला बनी कोरोना वार्ड

देश में कोरोना का प्रकोप अब भी जारी है और रोजाना नए मामले सामने आए रहे हैं। इसी बीच गुजरात स्थित कष्टभंजन हनुमानजी के मंदिर की धर्मशाला कोरोना वार्ड में तब्‍दील कर दिया गया है। यह मंदिर बोताड जिले के सारंगपुर में स्थित है। हनुमानजी के मंदिर को उनके नाम के अनुरूप कष्‍टभंजन यानी कष्‍टों को दूर करने वाले अस्‍पताल में बदल दिया गया है। मंदिर के व्‍यवस्‍थापकों ने संकट की इस घड़ी में खुद से आगे बढ़कर मंदिर की धर्मशाला 100 बेड के एक अस्‍पताल में बदल दिया है।

यज्ञ से वायरस का अंत, जानें क्या कहता है धर्म और विज्ञान
